data.name: spiner
data.description: Performance portable routines for generic, tabulated, multi-dimensional data

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are"
"Performance portable utilities for representing and interpolating tabulated data." (a reusable interpolation utility, included via CMake target)

"You can build `spiner` in-line with your project, or pre-install it. It's header-only and the include directories should have the expected structure. If you build inline, add the following target to your `cmake`: target_link_libraries(my_project PRIVATE spiner::spiner)"

checks.reason: no binaries found in the repo
checks.name: Binary-Artifacts

documentation.short: Determines if the project has generated executable (binary) artifacts in the source repository.

checks.reason: branch protection is not maximal on development and all release branches
checks.name: Branch-Protection

documentation.short: Determines if the default and release branches are protected with GitHub's branch protection settings.

checks.reason: 8 out of 9 merged PRs checked by a CI test -- score normalized to 8

documentation.short: Determines if the project runs tests before pull requests are merged.

documentation.short: Determines if the project has an OpenSSF (formerly CII) Best Practices Badge.

checks.name: Code-Review

documentation.short: Determines if the project requires human code review before pull requests (aka merge requests) are merged.
